abstract: Executives said they would add Internet services to Microsoft’s desktop applications to respond to the growing threat posed by rivals like Google.
snippet: Executives said they would add Internet services to Microsoft’s desktop applications to respond to the growing threat posed by rivals like Google.
lead_paragraph: REDMOND, Wash., July 26 — Microsoft executives said Thursday that they intended to respond to the growing threat to its software posed by rivals like Google that offer Web-based versions of its applications.

headline.print_headline: Microsoft Says It Will Offer Services to Counter Web-Based Challenges

abstract: New tools are allowing people with minimal skills to do what only professional mapmakers were able to do before.
snippet: New tools are allowing people with minimal skills to do what only professional mapmakers were able to do before.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 26  — On the Web, anyone can be a mapmaker.

headline.main: With Tools on Web, Amateurs Reshape Mapmaking
headline.print_headline: With Simple New Tools on Web, Amateurs Reshape Mapmaking

abstract: On the heels of its aQuantive purchase, Microsoft on Thursday announced it has bought AdECN, a company that is a technology platform for buying and selling display advertising. AdECN provides an ad exchange, like electronic stock trading markets, that allows publishers and advertisers to broker the sale of display advertising.
lead_paragraph: On the heels of its aQuantive purchase, Microsoft on Thursday announced it has bought AdECN, a company that is a technology platform for buying and selling display advertising. AdECN provides an ad exchange, like electronic stock trading markets, that allows publishers and advertisers to broker the sale of display advertising.

abstract: The morning headlines, with news about Microsoft, Yahoo, Twitter, Comcast, the BBC, and HBO.
snippet: The morning headlines, with news about Microsoft, Yahoo, Twitter, Comcast, the BBC, and HBO.
lead_paragraph: What will everyone be talking about today? A quick run through of the news of the day:

abstract: Exponential is a prime candidate, but the chief executive says, “no thank you.”
snippet: Exponential is a prime candidate, but the chief executive says, “no thank you.”
lead_paragraph: It’s become a virtual arms race in the online advertising world as Google, Yahoo, Microsoft and ad conglomerates like the WPP Group and Publicis Groupe buy up just about any company that puts “online” and “advertising” in their corporate description.

headline.main: Online Advertising: What’s Left to Buy?
